geosam also works with regular imagesâ€”photos, screenshots, or any image file. Results are returned in pixel coordinates rather than geographic coordinates.

### Basic detection

Use `sam_image()` for non-georeferenced images:

``` r
library(geosam)

dogs <- sam_image("photo.jpg", text = "dog")
dogs
```

### Viewing results

The `plot()` method overlays detections on the original image:

``` r
plot(dogs)
```

Customize colors:

``` r
plot(dogs, fill = "#3B82F6", border = "#1D4ED8")
```

### Extracting polygons

Convert to sf (coordinates are in pixels):

``` r
dogs_sf <- sam_as_sf(dogs)
```

The `area_px` column contains area in square pixels.

### Interactive exploration

Use `sam_explore_image()` for interactive detection on images:

``` r
result <- sam_explore_image("photo.jpg")
```
